reviewText: This DVD is a compilation of duets with Pavarotti and various "pop" stars of the 80's - 90's(plus JB) singing (non-cheesy)orchestrated versions of the stars' hit songs w/ some classical duets thrown in here and there. Each star does one song. This DVD concert was not shot in one evening or even one year. I sort of guessing here, but this DVD appears to span 10-20 yrs, so some of the singers & songs you may not have heard in quite a while, however; assuming you listen(ed) to the radio or watched MTV back when they actually played music..., they should all be familar to you. I think everybody does a decent job considering they are so very out of their element - some do better than others and some really hit the nail on the head! You can tell practically every star is a bit intimidated and rightfully so. I actually find it refreshing in a way...All practically "bow" so to speak, in the presence of what many consider to be the greatest singer in our lifetime. I love though, how Pavarotti helps ease their tensions with his warm personality, graciousness and that smile - probably having never even heard many of these songs he's singing before let alone knowing who some of these stars even are...(cue the tele-prompter). I had originally bought this just to see Pavarotti sing "This is a Man's World" with James Brown. That is well worth the price of the DVD alone! Maybe the oddest duet of all time..., but they do a truely excellent & memorable job!!! JB appears to be so very humble as does Parvarotti, not just with JB, but throughout this entire DVD. I first watched their duet on YouTube and that subsquently caused me to buy the Duets DVD. I'm glad I did! There are also some other stand-out duets.For the audiophiles & videophiles, this DVD shouldn't disappoint. Even though this DVD appears to span a couple of decades, James Brown's performance for example, looks exceptionally crisp, as does the Eurythmics', just to name two off the top of my head. They look great on my 72" screen. I'm assuming that when Pavarotti is sitting while singing, these would have been from more recent performances and would tend to have slightly better video quality. Some of the older performances, judging by the "less aged" looking stars, Pavarottti is standing and presumably healthier...The old stuffy Pavarotti fan might scoff, but the open-minded music lover will love this DVD and just might find themselves singing James Brown AND Pavarotti's version of This is a Man's World from now on...I know that has been the worm in my ear for months now lol. Now I have to wonder how JB and Pavarotti would have done on "Sex Machine" lol. We'll never know...Buy this!!!RIP JB & Pavarotti!
Title: N/A

reviewText: What I mean is, bring out the best of each of these performers - just imagine the best operatic tenor of all time singing with Celine, Eric Clapton, Maria, and even James Brown - yes, James Brown.  Pavarotti bridged the gap so to say, by showing that just because he has a high tenor opera voice doesn't mean he could not sing 'popular' tunes or sing with rock legends.  He did and not only did his voice shine but the stars he sang alongside with also sang to perfection.  To hear Sting singing Panis Angelicus (don't know if I spelled that one right), one of Pavarotti's best-known and most beloved Christmas hymns - wow.  I never heard Sting sing like that.  And Eric Clapton with his Holy Mother - I think this time it may have been the other way around - Clapton, known as one of the guitar greats, brought out the best in Pavarotti's 'popular' singing voice.  They, like Sting, sounded perfect together.  This is a 'must' buy for all Pavarotti fans.
summary: Only Pavarotti could pull this off.....
Title: N/A

reviewText: Having lived in Italy for a couple years when younger, I found this DVD so creative as having a surprisingly different slant in music.  I like the unexpected in music, and Pavarotti so satisfied my expectations in combining with other popular vocal artists to produce a great music experience.  A masterpiece. I don't regret buying this DVD, and Amazon is the best way to purchase it.The Duets [Luciano Pavarotti]

reviewText: This is so good. LP has such fun singing these duets. The arrangements are so good. My personal faverites are with James Brown Jon Bon Jovi, and Celine Dion. They are masterpieces. Wish they would have included the ones with Stevie Wonder and the Spice Girls here but you have to get the bigger video for around $65 to get them.
Title: N/A

reviewText: First off, this is NOT what I was expecting.  I thought, in my rapid purchase style,  this would be operatic duets.  It is instead better, a surprising diversity of duets with a mix of male and female stars from across multiple musical genres.  Pavarotti used the teleprompter on a number of occasions and was clearly working hard with material that he has not done hundreds of times before, and it all turned out exquisitely professional.The range of stage settings that were smoothly integrated with transitions between presentations, seemingly a different stage setting for each featured companion singer, was astonishing.My one disappointment was seeing a number of singers in the final act who a) misbehaved on stage (men talking to each other and generally being jerks) and b) did not make the cut from the live version to the dvd, including someone who to my old eyes looked remarkably like Liza Minelli.IfPavarotti and Friends [VHS] andPavarotti & Friends 2 [VHS] were in DVD I would be ordering them today--since they are not, this is opportunity lost for the producer who is not keeping up with technology.
summary: Unexpected Diversity, Uniform Excellence, Many Cuts from Live
